Pre-Game Insights: Germany takes on Greece in their final friendly game before they begin their quest for European Championship glory as the host country.
The two nations meet for the first time in 12 years after Die Mannschaft claimed a 4-2 victory in the quarter-finals of Euro 2012.
Julian Nagelsmann has experienced a relatively mixed start to life in the German hot seat since replacing Hansi Flick as head coach in September last year.

Greece are gearing up for their first fixture since March when they were eliminated from Euro 2024 qualifying following a heartbreaking penalty shootout defeat in a playoff semi-final against Georgia.
The players, Antonio Rüdiger and Toni Kroos, who were absent due to their UEFA Champions League finals fatigue will be available for this match.
The German team don’t have any injury concerns going into this game.
The away team also don’t have any injury issues and all players are fit to play in the upcoming match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany score 1.43 goals when playing at home and Greece score 0.5 goals when playing away (on average).
The winner of their last meeting was Germany.
When Germany leads 1-0 at home, they win 33% of their matches.
Germany have a good head-to-head record and are favourites to win against Greece.
Kick-Off: Friday, 7 June 2024 at 06:45 PM (GMT), 02:15 PM (EST), Saturday, 8 June 2024 at 12:15 AM (IST)
Germany predicted lineup (4-2-3-1): Neuer (GK); Kimmich, Tah, Rudiger, Mittelstadt; Kroos, Andrich; Musiala, Gundogan, Wirtz; Havertz
Greece predicted lineup (4-3-3): Vlachodimos (GK); Saliakas, Chatzidiakos, Mavropanos, Giannoulis; Bakesetas, Kourbelis, Mantalos; Masouras, Ioannidis, Tzolis
Telecast: India: Sony Sports Network, Sony Liv, UK: Premier Sports 2, USA: ESPN, FOX Sports, Nigeria: No Telecast
